parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To bury along with. From sun and thapto; to inter in company with, i.e. to assimilate spiritually.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The rite or ceremony of baptism. From baptizo; baptism.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Freshness, newness, novelty. From kainos; renewal.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
